intro: Misanteca brittoniana, commonly known as the Britton's mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to specific regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Viscaraceae family and typically grows on the branches of host trees, such as those in the genus Ficus. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers. Its berries are usually red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its specialized habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
